messages.title: Working Hard for Erith & Thamesmead
messages.content: SUPPORTING LOCAL JOBS - I have organised local jobs fairs with over 400 jobs offered. PROVIDING WHOLE-PERSON CARE - Residents are paying almost £740 a year more for vital home care services. RAISING SCHOOL STANDARDS FOR ALL - Every child needs a good school.

messages.title: My pledges to you
messages.content: I will work to raise the minimum wage to £8 and ban exploitative zero hour contracts. I will work for the future of our NHS with 36,000 more frontline staff. I will work on rent controls and help deliver a fairer deal for private renters. I will work to ensure that the benefits of Crossrail are felt by all in Erith & Thamesmead. I will continue to tell you the truth even when it’s not popular.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Organised local jobs fairs, offering over 400 jobs and giving opportunities to thousands of people.
Highlighting the increase in costs for residents needing home care services and advocating for whole-person care.
Advocating for good local schools for every child, backed by qualified teachers.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Minimum Wage and Zero Hour Contracts
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plan to raise the minimum wage to £8 and ban exploitative zero hour contracts.
Ensure the future of the NHS with a commitment to 36,000 more frontline staff.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Rent Controls and Fairer Deal for Renters
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Work on implementing rent controls and delivering a fairer deal for private renters.
Ensure that the benefits of Crossrail are felt by all in Erith & Thamesmead.

issues.economy: Supporting local jobs, raising minimum wage to £8, and banning exploitative zero-hour contracts.
issues.health: Future of our NHS with 36,000 more frontline staff.

housing.content: Work on rent controls and help deliver a fairer deal for private renters.

images.caption: Teresa Pearce canvassing in the neighborhood.
